summary: The LDS Church, or Mormon Church, is a large Christian denomination founded in 1830 by Joseph Smith. It started in New York and moved to several states before settling in Utah. The church has over 17 million members worldwide and is known for its temples and missionaries. It teaches that Jesus Christ leads the church through its president, who is seen as a modern-day prophet. Members follow church laws and believe in Jesus' atonement for humanity. The church has faced criticism, especially for its past practice of polygamy.
title: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
